metadata.proposal_title: Towards Effective Detection of N-Day Vulnerabilities in Third-Party Software Components

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: The project is developing a model of binary code scanning for the identification of vulnerabilities through similarity detection. This is aligned with “Computational Science and Visualization -> Programming models”. Pytorch is a good software to develop the architecture of a model.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No prohibited use/functionality is included in the scope of this project. The proposed AI model is to implement cybersecurity to scan the binary codes for vulnerabilities.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: The project is developing a model of binary code scanning for the identification of vulnerabilities through similarity detection. This is aligned with “Computational Science and Visualization → Programming models”. The ubuntu image is requested so that LLVM compiler >18.0 can be installed. The requirement of the image and the compiler is justified because it will be used to create the required training dataset on the Shaheen III CPU and GPU.  A check in an in-person meeting is recommended to confirm that the created dataset is infact the one approved.
